column4: hey all, I mixed up some different version of gtkpod (one from the repos and one from source) and now I can't load gtkpod...it just gives a segmentation fault, dumps a core, and won't start...how can I make things right? (removing and adding gtkpod from aptitude doesn't fix anything)
delete the config folders for that appl probably a hidden one in your home folder
make a launcher on your desktop for  xterm
I already have launchers for the terminal, but I want to be able to use the virtual terminal
are you talking about the alt+f2   run dialog box ?
no, CTRL-ALT-F# for different TTY virtual terminals
that 's probably because you send a file in there you have no permission to delete
no, it does that with any file I put in it
I did that and it still complains. says "/home/tgel...rash/blah" cannot be deleted because you do not have permissions to modify its parent folder"
someone told you to open the trash can and try ctrl+h on it to see if there are hidden files in there
check your users permisson settings, in menu > system > admin > users
check in the forum for other possibilities
and there is a file in there ?
no, not currently. the trash empties fine...but it pops up that error every time and it's annoying
